level.heading: EFFECT ON CURRENT COMPENSATED LEAVE POLICIES (§ 7-3212) An employer that has a paid leave policy, (for example, paid time off orniversal leave) that gives the employee paid leave options to utilize at themployee’s discretion, which allow the accrual and usage of leave that are ateast equivalent to the paid leave prescribed in the Act, shall not be requiredo modify that policy An existing compensated leave policy shall be presumed to be equivalent toequirements of the Act if the policy allows the employee to: Access and accrue compensated leave at the same rate or greater than the hoursf leave provided in § 3201 of this Chapter; or Use the compensated leave for the same purposes as those set forth in § 3203.
